text: [Music]
welcome to what's new with AWS I'm
Randall Hutton senior Technical
Evangelist at AWS and I'll be filling in
for Jeff Bar this week there are a lot
of great launches to cover so let's jump
right in
first up ABS ground station is now
generally available this is a service
that lets you communicate with
satellites in low Earth orbit
and medium Earth orbit across a number
of different radio frequencies and
download that data directly into an
address region for processing hopping
over to the databases side in the
relational world we launched the data
API for Aurora serverless which lets us
make sequel queries over a secure HTTP
endpoint with built in connection
pooling integration with secrets manager
for database credentials and a familiar
JSON API this should enable a lot of
service applications to access
traditional my sequel databases without
exhausting connections this API is
provided at no additional charge in the
no sequel world Amazon DynamoDB adaptive
capacity is now instant back in August
of 2018 we launched adaptive capacity
for dynamodb which allowed individual
dynamodb partitions to exceed the
provisionary to write throughput prior
to this update those changes took
between 5 and 30 minutes to apply but
now they apply instantly if this helps
your workloads please let me in the team
know finally one quick update from
storage coordinated point in time crash
consistent snapshots across multiple EBS
volumes I cannot count the number of
times this feature would have saved me
back when I was a customer rate of us
and I'm excited to see people who run
multiple volumes take advantage of it
these are just some of the exciting
launches from the past few weeks for the
full list check the website thanks for
watching I'd love it if you gave me a
follow on twitter @jrfromptc
[Music]
you
